sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. I'm Raoul Sarn. It's the 25th of April. It's great to have you with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Let's take a look at your top stories today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron says he'll work to unite the nation after defeating far-right challenger Marine Le Pen to secure a second five-year term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Slovenia, a projected landslide for an opposition Liberal Party in Sunday's parliamentary vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a major defeat for the country's populist prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And US secretaries of state and defence hold talks in Kyiv with President Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's the highest level American delegation to visit Ukraine since the start of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron has pledged to unite France after a decisive victory against the nationalist far right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The country's interior ministry predicted the 44-year-old secured a majority with 58.5 to 41.1% of the vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He praised the electorate, who gave him five more years at the Elysee Palace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Finally, I speak to all those who voted for Madame Le Pen, who are disappointed this evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: No, don't boo anybody.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I have always asked you not to boo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Because from now, I'm no longer a candidate on one side, but the president of all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Le Pen conceded defeat, although didn't congratulate Macron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, the 53-year-old claimed Sunday's election a success after winning more than 12 million votes with 43%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: She vowed to continue the political fight and never abandon France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With more than 43% of the vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tonight's result is in itself a brilliant victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Tonight we launch the great electoral battle of the legislative elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I will lead this battle alongside Jordan Bordel, with all those who have the courage to oppose Emmanuel Macron, in the second round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In short, with all those who have a nation at heart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Macron will now focus on creating a package before the summer to ease the cost of living and the parliamentary elections in June. He is seeking a majority for his centrist grouping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With this victory, Emmanuel Macron has just become the first French president to be re-elected in

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 15 years. And his re-election is significant significant not only because this was a tight race but also because this is a deeply divided country where all major political parties have all but vanished from the political spectrum speaking in front of the Eiffel Tower on Sunday evening and Emmanuel Macron thanked his supporters for trusting him after five difficult years and also thanked those who voted for him only to block the far right, promising to be the president of all French.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron also promised the next term won't be a continuation of the last five years but something new, something better, something that will make France more independent and Europe stronger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He also acknowledged the anger and the division of the last five years but promised to make his next term historic. He said that this is going to be a project that must be led with courage but it's going to be a project that won't leave anyone behind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron who performed a very symbolic moment in this victory night when he walked towards his victory speech, he conveyed a very different image from five years ago when he walked alone towards the stage to the sound of Ode to Joy, the anthem of the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This evening he was walking surrounded by the First Lady but also by a group of French youth for whom Emmanuel Macron promised to transform this country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Anneliese Borges in Paris for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For the European Union, the re-election of Emmanuel Macron is a relief. Many leaders and

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: officials were quick to react after the announcement of the incumbent president's success against far-right candidate Marine Le Pen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They all praised the French president's European commitment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For the 27, this means that in the very short term, the work of the French presidency of the EU will continue unabated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the longer term, the result of this presidential election announces Paris' desire to continue and even accelerate integration between the member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the face of the war in Ukraine, Emmanuel Macron is likely to persevere in advancing European defence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The French president also wants to put the climate at the heart of his action to reduce European dependence on Russian gas and oil and increase the share of renewable energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In this effort, Emmanuel Macron can rely on the Franco-German couple.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The electoral calendar will allow Paris and Berlin to plan together for the years to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But behind this electoral success, the French president and the European institutions will not be able to spare themselves an in-depth reflection on the distress expressed by Marine Le Pen's voters against the common project. The Union will have to provide innovative answers if it wants to reassure citizens in France and in the member states. Grégoire Laurie, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: member states. Grégoire Laurie, Euronews, Brussels. France was not the only country to hold national elections. In Slovenia, the Liberal Freedom

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Movement Party celebrate after exit poll results show that they have won the general election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The newcomers received around 34% of the vote. The leader, Robert Golub, made his address via video call, as he is believed to have COVID.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have not had voter turnout like this in 20 years. And that says it all. It tells you that people really want change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And people trust us as the only ones who can bring those changes. And don't forget, hope gives birth to expectations and hope gives birth to our responsibilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Slovenia's right-wing populist prime minister, Janis Jansa, had hoped to win a fourth term in office, but the SDS party only secured more than 23% of the vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We would never behave the way the opposition did over the past two years. Slovenia fought the pandemic and we received everything except support and cooperation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Even in opposition, the Slovenian Democratic Party will behave differently in a statement-like manner. have different in a statement like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Experts say the election's 68% turnout was above the national average.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The U.S. Secretary of State and the U.S. Defense Secretary met with the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv last night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's the highest-level visit from a US official to the country since the Russian invasion began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Zelensky said before Antony Blinken and Lloyd Austin's arrival that he was hopeful for weapons, not cake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Why is it essential that leaders come to us? I will answer you pragmatically. You cannot come to us empty-handed right now. We are expecting specific things and specific weapons. I believe that we will be able to obtain from the United States what we agreed on or part of an arms package for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Authorities will try and establish humanitarian routes out of Mariupol on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, as the country enters its third month of war, the UN has called for an immediate stop to fighting in the besieged port city to allow more than 100,000 trapped civilians to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In a tweet on Sunday, the UN crisis coordinator for Ukraine, Amin Awad, wrote the lives of tens of thousands, including women, children and older people, are at stake at Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They must be allowed to safely evacuate now, today. Tomorrow could be too late.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to reports, Russian troops continue to bombard the Azovstal steel plant at the weekend, where around a thousand civilians are hiding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, Russia continues to deny its troops are targeting civilians, as Russian President Vladimir Putin attended an Orthodox Easter ceremony in Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But in Ukraine, the fierce fighting casts a shadow over the traditional festivities, with no sign from Russia of easing their attacks.
